# Workspace Custom Instructions

## Modern Web Project Setup with Vite

This is a vanilla JavaScript web project using Vite as the build tool.

### Project Checklist
- [x] Verify that the copilot-instructions.md file in the .github directory is created
- [x] Clarify Project Requirements - Vanilla frontend web project
- [x] Scaffold the Project - Created with Vite structure
- [x] Install Required Extensions - None required for vanilla JavaScript
- [x] Compile the Project - Ready to run `npm install`
- [x] Create and Run Task - Tasks configured in .vscode/tasks.json
- [x] Launch the Project - Ready with `npm run dev`
- [x] Ensure Documentation is Complete - README.md created and updated

### Getting Started
1. Install Node.js (v14+) if not already installed
2. Run `npm install` to install Vite dependencies
3. Run `npm run dev` to start the development server
4. Open `http://localhost:5173` in your browser

### Available Commands
- `npm run dev` - Start development server
- `npm run build` - Build for production
- `npm run preview` - Preview production build

### Project Structure
```
.
├── index.html           - Main HTML entry point
├── package.json         - Project dependencies and scripts
├── vite.config.js       - Vite configuration
├── src/
│   ├── main.js         - Main JavaScript entry point
│   └── style.css       - Global styles
└── .vscode/
    └── tasks.json      - VS Code tasks for development
```
